raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How was your day?
User: It's been great! Had some decaf coffee and a good lunch. How was yours?
System: Pretty good, thanks!
User: What'd you do today?
System: Stayed home and played video games.
User: Oh nice! What games?
System: Dying Light, Borderlands 2, and Bioshock Infinite.
User: Oh interesting. Which is your fav?
System: Dying Light, hands down.
User: Why?
System: It's just so fun.
User: Yeah but like what about it? Is it an FPS?
System: It's like Mirror's Edge, only in a zombie apocalypse.
User: Oh that's kinda cool!
System: It's hella fun.
User: Nice.
System: So, how have you been?
User: Fantastic

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello there!
User: How's your day going?
System: I've seen better days, how about you?
User: I'm good I'm good. What's getting you down?
System: The clouds overhead are playing on your mind, any plans for the coming vacations?
User: I'm thinking of going to visit my family. How about you?
System: Was thinking the same, where does your family live?
User: They're in New York. How about yours?
System: Mine is in India, it is a long way away.
User: Ahh what city? I've visited India before.
System: Hyderabad, it is a beautiful city in the southern part of India. Which cities have you gone to in India?
User: Hyderabad! and Bangalore! Great food in both cities! Is it still hot this time of year?

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: How are you?
System: My logic and cognitive functions are normal.
User: That's funny. I just got to work!
System: I am so delighted that you are amused. OK, better get busy.
User: I'm procrastinating though.
System: Oh. What are you waiting for?
User: Inspiration to hit me.
System: Do you have only a few friends?
User: How is that related, lol?
System: It isn't. I was just being random. Did I amuse you?
User: Yeah that was funny though I could see it coming across as judgemental.
System: Good. People seem more friendly towards me when they are happy. What's so funny?
User: Nothing anymore. What are you up to today?

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Wow, hello. Can't believe we are finally talking!
User: Yeah, sorry for the long gap! I heard you took a break and were travelling around the world. How was the travel?
System: It was an interesting trip. I got to see some exotic places. For example, I hiked the Son Doong cave in Vietnam. It's the biggest and deepest cave in the world.
User: Great! Vietnam is still in my TODO bucket list. Did you also visit cambodia and other neighboring places?
System: Yes. Laos and Cambodia are the two neighboring countries. Cambodia has an exotic culture. They sell spiders, scorpions, and grasshoppers as street food! It took a lot of courage for me to try them.
User: Hehe! How long was the stay?

Sample5:

System: Sure, human relationships sounds like a good topic. . I like kebabs.
User: Kebab is food, not a relationship
System: . Oh kebabs taste lovely but they are not very healthy for you.
User: I love a kebab but I would not make love to it

User: I'm actually not into kebabs at all
System: Oh, I love them. They are yummy.
User: can we not talk about food

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey you! How's it going?
User: Not bad. Feeling quite chipper. What about yourself
System: Doing good! I'm glad you're feeling chipper.
User: So tell me, what's your favorite sport?
System: Football or soccer. You?
User: Cricket.
System: Favorite team?
User: Rajasthan Royals. Go Royals!
System: Favorite player?
User: Do you mean all time fave, or current player in the Royals?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: What was the most difficult thing you experienced this past year?
User: I normally don't reflect back too much on things, but i guess 2019 have been very favorable for me in terms of time spent with family and friends and work life balance. Why do you ask?
System: I just released a book on REDACTED_TERM to help people process the past 12 months and start the new year with a fresh outlook :)
User: Great! Good idea to help people figuring out their new year resolutions :) So how do i get a fresher outlook? :)
System: Well, in my book, I took inspiration for the 24 days of Advent, and put together a workbook that you fill out each day for 24 days. It goes through accomplishments, passions, understanding, forgiveness, with each day a different theme.
User: Wow! Sounds amazing if we practice that! I think the idea does have some potential. How did you come up with this idea?
System: We created a scholarship for leaders from REDACTED_TERM to visit an international institute at REDACTED_TERM for which there was no African representation. During the program, we also did a lot of coaching with the young leaders. This book captures a bit of that journey that we are all on, and also all the proceeds are going to fund next year's cohort. 
User: Thats great! This is valuable help for the community. I think mental health is one of the bigger challenges facing humanity. 
System: I think if we were all able to bring out our best selves, the world would be much better. When did you first realize mental health was important?
User: That is actually a quote stolen from my TL when i joined my first company after graduation. I guess now after 5 yrs of work experience, I fully agree with it :)
System: What do you prioritize in your life? Like top 5 things?
User: 1. stay happy; I think family and friends play a big role here. 2. Meaningful work life; this may mean exploring around with new stuff 3. multiple hobbies that keep you busy ... so on :) What about you? is there a right answer to this? :)
System:  1) The idea of what it must be like to be "on Earth as it is in Heaven" from the Lord's prayer. I feel like we were designed for a purpose, rather than random chance. A more concrete way to put it is simply show love to the greatest capacity we can. 2) Taking care of myself physically, mentally, spiritually. 3) Family 4) Work 5) Music
User: Nice! That's very thoughtful and spiritual :) Also music earned a spot :) yay! 

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: Sorry I'm late! I was held up in traffic.
System: There is no need to apologise. Are you late? Better hurry along then. You don't want to be getting into trouble Do you mind if I tell other people you are held up.
User: I meant sorry I'm late for this meeting!
System: Oh I see. There is no need to apologise. Are you late? Better hurry along then. You don't want to be getting into trouble
User: I said I was sorry I was late for this meeting! I have nowhere else to go right now!
System: Do you really mean it? Are you late? Better hurry along then. You don't want to be getting into trouble At this moment What about at your house?
User: Huh? Are you okay?
System: What? I am fine.
User: You seem to be repeating yourself.
System: Well stop saying, "Are you okay?" to me all the time then.
User: I only said it once!
System: I know. I just heard you.
User: Okay, whatever. So what is on the agenda today?

Sample9:

Conversation History:

System: hey, whats up?
User: I was not able to attend the lectures last week. Can you help me understand some concepts?
System: well, I'm not sure I'm the best for the job, but I can try!
User: I was not able to figure out the last few slides. I think its best to discuss this in person. Do you have time right now?
System: I'm afraid not, right now I'm in a meeting and I'll be going for lunch afterwards. How about tomorrow at noon?
User: No problem! Sure. We still have plenty of time for the test. Anyways, how's your preparation going?
System: not feeling too sure about it tbh. I've been super busy so I haven't study much :(. I might join some of the study sessions later
User: Same feeling here! But i think the syllabus may not that tough. You may be able to cover it up over the weekend.
